item.description:
I had to cancel the last one for personal reasons, so this is a make up walk... Join me at Lincoln Woods Park for an afternoon 5 mile walk around Olney Pond. It's getting warm out, so let's get walking!

Once around Olney Pond is about 2.5 miles, and I am going for twice around. You are welcome to quit anytime, or if you're up for a challenge we can go for a third time around!

If you are familiar with Lincoln Woods, then I will meet you near the Rt. 146 booth entrance. When coming in via Rt. 146 entrance, turn RIGHT into the park headed towards the beach. Just past the entrance, AFTER turning right, there is a big rock on your left. This is where I will meet you. If you drive past the rock, there is a parking lot on the left just before the beach. You can park there or on the side in the dirt anywhere near the entrance.

Here is a map with of the park: Lincoln Woods State Park Map

About Lincoln Woods State Park:

Nestled between routes 146 and routes 123 , Lincoln Woods State Park is one of Blackstone Valley's great treasures. A short ride from Providence, Pawtucket, and Cumberland, it is a popular get away for northeastern Rhode Islanders. Visitors can enjoy swimming at the fresh water beach, trout fishing, playing ball, hiking, jogging, horseback riding, or just relaxing under a shade tree.

P.S. If it rains, I will send out a message if I decide to cancel this event. Hopefully I won't have to cancel this time!
item.how_to_find_us: Meet me by the big boulder at the Rt. 146 entrance. Come into the entrance, turn Right, and the boulder is on the left.
item.why: I cancelled the last one, so this is a makeup walk.
item.name: Spring into Step! - Join me for a 2.5 to 5 mile walk at Lincoln Woods
